intro: Zigadenus micranthus var. fontanus, commonly known as the Fontana death camas, is a toxic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces a bulbous rhizome and has narrow, grass-like leaves. It is highly poisonous, containing toxic alkaloids that can be fatal to humans and animals. Due to its toxicity and resemblance to edible plants, it is often mistaken for other species and requires careful identification.
